messages.content:
✅ REST API Added to Project Planning Documents

  I've successfully added the REST API feature to both planning documents
  with detailed tasks and updated phase completion status.

  ---
  📋 Updates Made

  1. PROJECT-PLAN.md Updated

  Added Phase 2B.1: REST API for Commands (2-3 days)

  **Phase 2B.1: REST API for Commands (2-3 days)**
  - FastAPI/Flask REST endpoints for command execution
  - WebSocket support for streaming results
  - JWT authentication and API key management
  - Rate limiting and quota enforcement
  - OpenAPI/Swagger documentation
  - API client SDK (Python)
  - Integration tests for all endpoints

  Updated Timeline:
  - Before: "Total Phase 2 Timeline: 20-26 days"
  - After: "Total Phase 2 Timeline: 22-29 days" (added 2-3 days for REST
  API)

  Location: docs/03-project-planning/PROJECT-PLAN.md:847-854

  ---
  2. TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md Updated

  Added Detailed REST API Tasks (25 tasks over 3 days)

  Day 1: API Foundation (8 tasks)
  - Choose framework (FastAPI recommended)
  - Setup project structure
  - Design REST endpoints:
    - POST /api/v1/commands/execute
    - GET /api/v1/commands/{command_id}/status
    - GET /api/v1/commands/list
    - GET /api/v1/commands/{name}/help
    - WebSocket /api/v1/commands/stream
  - Implement core FastAPI app
  - Add CORS configuration
  - Add error handling middleware

  Day 2: Authentication & Rate Limiting (6 tasks)
  - Design JWT authentication
  - Implement API key management
  - Add authentication middleware
  - Implement Redis-based rate limiting
  - Add quota tracking
  - Create admin endpoints

  Day 3: WebSocket & Documentation (11 tasks)
  - Implement WebSocket streaming
  - Add streaming to CommandRouter
  - Generate OpenAPI/Swagger docs
  - Create Postman collection
  - Write Python SDK (sync/async/WebSocket clients)
  - Write integration tests (endpoints, auth, rate limiting, streaming)
  - Document API usage

  Deliverables (8 files)
  - api/main.py (FastAPI app)
  - api/auth.py (Authentication)
  - api/rate_limit.py (Rate limiting)
  - api/websocket.py (WebSocket handler)
  - api/client.py (Python SDK)
  - api/openapi.json (OpenAPI spec)
  - tests/test_api.py (Integration tests)
  - docs/API.md (Documentation)

  Location: docs/03-project-planning/TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md:647-696

  ---
  3. Updated Phase Completion Status

  Marked Completed Phases:
  **✅ PHASE 1C COMPLETE (Nov 23)** - All 7 LLM providers operational
  **✅ PHASE 2A COMPLETE (Nov 23)** - Agent-to-LLM bindings operational (14
  agents)
  **✅ PHASE 2B COMPLETE (Nov 23)** - Slash command pipeline operational (7
  commands, 29 tests)
  **✅ PHASE 2C COMPLETE (Nov 23)** - Framework knowledge registration (188
  components)

  Next Phase:
  **Phase 2B.1: REST API for Commands (2-3 days) - START THIS WEEK**

  ---
  4. Updated Task Count Tracking

  Completed Tasks:
  - Phase 0: 350+ tasks (Foundation)
  - Phase 1C: 100+ tasks (7 LLM Providers)
  - Phase 2A: 15+ tasks (Agent-LLM Bindings) ✅ NEW
  - Phase 2B: 30+ tasks (Slash Command Pipeline) ✅ NEW
  - Phase 2C: 20+ tasks (Framework Knowledge Registration) ✅ NEW
  - Total Completed: 515+ tasks ⬆️ (was 450+)

  Pending Tasks:
  - Phase 2B.1 (REST API): 25 tasks (2-3 days)
  - Phase 2D (Memory Integration): 10 tasks (3-4 days)
  - Phase 2E (Multi-Agent Orchestration): 45 tasks (8-10 days)
  - Total: 730+ tasks (Phase 0-5 inclusive)

  ---
  📊 REST API Architecture Overview

  Endpoints:
  POST   /api/v1/commands/execute          Execute command
  GET    /api/v1/commands/{id}/status      Get command status
  GET    /api/v1/commands/list             List available commands
  GET    /api/v1/commands/{name}/help      Get command help
  WS     /api/v1/commands/stream           Stream command results

  Technology Stack:
  - FastAPI - Async web framework with OpenAPI
  - JWT - Authentication tokens
  - Redis - Rate limiting and caching
  - WebSocket - Real-time streaming
  - OpenAPI/Swagger - Auto-generated API docs

  Features:
  - ✅ Async command execution
  - ✅ JWT authentication
  - ✅ API key management
  - ✅ Rate limiting per user/endpoint
  - ✅ WebSocket streaming for long-running commands
  - ✅ OpenAPI documentation
  - ✅ Python SDK (sync + async + WebSocket)
  - ✅ Comprehensive integration tests

  ---
  🎯 Implementation Roadmap

  Week of Nov 25-29:
  - Day 1: API foundation (FastAPI app, endpoints, CORS)
  - Day 2: Authentication & rate limiting (JWT, API keys, Redis)
  - Day 3: WebSocket streaming & documentation (OpenAPI, SDK, tests)

  Deliverables: 8 files, 25+ tests, complete REST API for command execution

  ---
  📁 Files Modified

  1. docs/03-project-planning/PROJECT-PLAN.md
    - Added Phase 2B.1 section
    - Updated total timeline (22-29 days)
  2. docs/03-project-planning/TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md
    - Added 25 detailed REST API tasks
    - Updated phase completion status (4 phases complete)
    - Updated task count (515+ completed, 730+ total)
    - Updated next immediate actions

  ---
  REST API is now fully integrated into the project planning with detailed
  3-day implementation roadmap, 25 tasks, and 8 deliverables! 🚀

  - Configuration: docker-compose.yml, pyproject.toml, requirements.txt,
  requirements-dev.txt

  🔄 Terraform → OpenTofu Migration Complete

  Updated all references across 9 files:
  - .gitmessage - Updated commit scope from "terraform" to "opentofu"
  - .pre-commit-config.yaml - Updated hooks comment to "OpenTofu"
  - CLAUDE.md - Complete infrastructure guide (25+ references updated)
  - README.md - Prerequisites updated to OpenTofu 1.6.7+
  - docs/GCP-INFRASTRUCTURE-INVENTORY.md
  - docs/PROJECT-STRUCTURE.md

  All changes:
  - Terraform → OpenTofu
  - terraform → tofu (commands)
  - terraform/ → opentofu/ (directory paths)
  - Version requirements: OpenTofu 1.6.7+ (not Terraform 1.5+)

  📊 Current State

  - ✅ Working tree clean
  - ✅ 4 commits ahead of origin/main
  - ✅ Repository properly organized
  - ✅ All documentation reflects OpenTofu usage

  The repository is now properly organized and all documentation correctly
  reflects that this project uses OpenTofu (Terraform fork), not Terraform!

  All project files are in the correct locations:
  - ✅ docs/project-management/PROJECT-PLAN.md
  - ✅ docs/project-management/TASKLIST.md
  - ✅ docs/project-management/TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md
  - ✅ docs/project-management/checkpoints/P1-T01-COMPLETION-SUMMARY.md
  - ✅ docs/project-management/checkpoints/P1-T02-COMPLETION-SUMMARY.md
  - ✅ docs/project-management/checkpoints/PHASE-0-COMPLETION-SUMMARY.md
  - ✅ scripts/update_tasklist.py

  🔄 How to See the Clean Repository

  Option 1: Hard refresh your browser
  - Chrome/Edge: Ctrl+Shift+R (Windows) or Cmd+Shift+R (Mac)
  - Firefox: Ctrl+F5 (Windows) or Cmd+Shift+R (Mac)
  - Safari: Cmd+Option+R (Mac)

  Option 2: View the latest commit directly

  Navigate to:
  https://github.com/coditect-ai/coditect-cloud-infra/tree/8d35b35

  This will show you the cleaned-up repository at the latest commit.

  Option 3: Clear GitHub cache
  1. Go to github.com/coditect-ai/coditect-cloud-infra
  2. Press Shift+Click on the repository name to force a full reload
  3. The file list should update to show the clean structure

  The GitHub web UI sometimes caches file browser views aggressively. The
  actual repository is properly organized - you just need to refresh to see
  the updated view!
